DOC.brief_title: The Effects Ankle Foot Orthoses ( AFOs ) Mobility Persons With Multiple Sclerosis ( MS )
DOC.detailed_description: This non-randomized , single group ( N=15 ) , repeat measure study . The outcome measure study include : 1 . GAITRite System step length , 2 . EMG anterior tibialis , gastrocnemius , soleus , vastus lateralis muscle , 3 . 6 Minute Walk Test ( gait endurance ) 4 . 12-Item MS Walking Scale ( Quality Life assessment ) . This study 24 week long . Over 24-week period , subject participate 14 gait training session week 1 , 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 , 8 , 10 , 12 , 14 , 17 , 20 23 . The treatment 45-60 minute duration . Outcome measure ( part ) assess follow time : initial ( T1 ) , week 5 ( T2 ) , week 13 ( T3 ) , week 24 ( T4 ) . Subjects closely monitor throughout 24 week study un-enrolled self-request follow medical reason : 1 . Acute exacerbation MS symptom , 2 . New diagnosis direct consequence affect gait training , 3 . Inability tolerate AFO .
DOC.criteria: Individuals primary diagnosis multiple sclerosis Individuals able maintain walk velocity 30 cm/sec least 2 minute independently use single tip assistive device . Could current past history single bilateral AFO use , include neuroprostheses Evidence weakness plantarflexors The presence comorbidities ( neuromuscular musculoskeletal ) would negatively impact gait training Individuals BMI > /= 40kg/m2 Individuals range motion deficit ankle limit passive range motion neutral dorsiflexion Individuals plan begin use Ampyra course study Individuals cost orthosis would represent financial burden Individuals receive concurrent physical therapy service elsewhere MSNQ > 22
